page.title: 15Great Totham School
page.content: In 1971 the old village schools of Great Totham and Wickham Bishops amalgamated to form the new Great Totham County Primary School, on a site in Walden House Road. The school was built on a semi open plan design. There are 6 Infant classes and 9 Junior Classes in the school at present, comprising of 448 children and 17 teachers. The Headmaster has been at the school since it opened. The school has a learner pool and an infant outside work area provided by the P.T.A. It has 5 B.B.C. micro- computers. It has a strong musical tradition. Many clubs and societies meet before and after school: Gymnastics, Country Dancing, Soccer, Netball, Chess, Needlework, Y.O.C., Computers, Orchestra, Short Tennis, and Badminton.
